name: Peyvên Pirsê û Malbat
description: Learn the 8 Kurdish question words, cardinal directions, family vocabulary with maternal/paternal distinctions, and singular-to-plural possessives.

lessons.name: Peyvên Pirsê
lessons.description: Learn the 8 Kurdish question words: çi, çawa, çend, çima, kî, kê, li ku, ji ku — and cardinal directions.
lessons.learningObjective: Learn the 8 Kurdish question words: çi, çawa, çend, çima, kî, kê, li ku, ji ku — and cardinal directions

content.example: Ev çi ye? — Ev av e.
content.exampleTranslation: What is this? — This is water.

content.example: Tu çawa yî? — Ez baş im.
content.exampleTranslation: How are you? — I am good.

content.example: Tu çima digirî? — Ez nexweş im, loma digirîm.
content.exampleTranslation: Why are you crying? — I am sick, therefore I am crying.

activities.instruction: Learn the difference: kî vs. kê

content.example: Tu kî yî? — Tu kê dibînî?
content.exampleTranslation: Who are you? — Whom do you see?

lines.ku: Ev çi ye? — Ev jîrfon e.
lines.en: What is this? — This is a smartphone.

lines.ku: Tu çawa yî? — Ez baş im.
lines.en: How are you? — I am good.

lines.ku: Tu çend salî yî? — Ez bîst û yek salî me.
lines.en: How old are you? — I am 21 years old.

lines.ku: Tu çima digirî? — Ez nexweş im, loma digirîm.
lines.en: Why are you crying? — I am sick, therefore I cry.

lines.ku: Tu kî yî? — Ez Hêlîn im.
lines.en: Who are you? — I am Hêlîn.

lines.ku: Tu kê dibînî? — Ez keçê dibînim.
lines.en: Whom do you see? — I see the girl.

lines.ku: Li ku bi almanî çi ye? — Li ku bi almanî wo ye.
lines.en: What is 'li ku' in German? — 'Li ku' in German is 'wo' (where).

lines.ku: Ji ku bi almanî çi ye? — Ji ku bi almanî woher ye.
lines.en: What is 'ji ku' in German? — 'Ji ku' in German is 'woher' (where from).

activities.instruction: "Tu kê dibînî?" — What does 'kê' mean here?

content.explanation: kê = whom (accusative/object). It asks about the person being seen. Compare: kî = who (subject), kê = whom (object). "Tu kê dibînî?" = Whom do you see?

activities.instruction: "Tu ji ku derê Kurdistanê yî?" — "Ez ji bakurê Kurdistanê me." What is bakur?

content.explanation: bakur = north. The four directions: bakur (north), başûr (south), rojava (west), rojhilat (east). "Ez ji bakurê Kurdistanê me" = I am from northern Kurdistan.
çend = how many. "Tu çend salî yî?" = How old are you? (Literally: You how-many years-old are?)
ji ku = where from. "Tu ji ku yî?" = Where are you from?

lessons.name: Malbat û Diyalog
lessons.description: Learn 10+ family terms with maternal/paternal distinctions, singular-to-plural possessives, and the verb hatin (to come).
lessons.learningObjective: Learn 10+ family terms, singular-to-plural possessives, and the verb hatin (to come)

content.translation: ez têm, tu tê, ew tê, em/hûn/ew tên
content.exampleTranslation: My cousin comes from the university.

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Xatiya te çend salî ye?
lines.en: How old is your aunt (maternal)?

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Xatiya min çil salî ye.
lines.en: My aunt is 40 years old.

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Ew çi karî dike?
lines.en: What is her job?

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Ew mamoste ye.
lines.en: She is a teacher.

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Ew kê dibîne?
lines.en: Whom does she see?

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Xatiya min xalê xwe dibîne.
lines.en: My aunt sees her (own) uncle.

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Navê kurxalê te çi ye?
lines.en: What is your cousin's (maternal, male) name?

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Navê kurxalê min Alan e. Ew panzdeh salî ye.
lines.en: My cousin's name is Alan. He is 15 years old.

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Bapîrê te baş e?
lines.en: Is your grandfather well?

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Erê, bapîrê min baş e. Ew pir dikene.
lines.en: Yes, my grandfather is well. He laughs a lot.

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Ew ji ku ye?
lines.en: Where is he from?

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Ew ji Îngilistanê ye.
lines.en: He is from England.

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Pismamê te ji ku tê?
lines.en: Where does your cousin (paternal, male) come from?

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Pismamê min ji zanîngehê tê. Ew dibe endezyar.
lines.en: My cousin comes from the university. He will become an engineer.

activities.instruction: What is the difference between xal and ap?

options: xal = uncle (mother's side), ap = uncle (father's side)
content.explanation: Kurdish distinguishes maternal and paternal relatives: xal = uncle (mother's brother), ap = uncle (father's brother). Similarly: xatî = aunt (mother's side), met = aunt (father's side).

activities.instruction: "Bapîrê min baş e. Ew pir dikene." — What does bapîr do?

content.explanation: dikene = laughs (from kenîn). pir = a lot. "Ew pir dikene" = He laughs a lot.

activities.instruction: Study singular to plural possessive changes

lines.ku: Diya min çiya dibîne. → Diyên me çiya dibînin.
lines.en: My mother sees the mountain. → Our mothers see the mountain.

lines.ku: Xalê min pêjgîrê difroşe. → Xalên me pêjgîrê difroşin.
lines.en: My uncle sells pots. → Our uncles sell pots.

lines.ku: Bapîrê te sîrê dixwe. → Bapîrên we sîrê dixwin.
lines.en: Your grandfather eats garlic. → Your grandfathers eat garlic.

lines.ku: Birayê min solê dişo. → Birayên we solê dişon.
lines.en: My brother washes shoes. → Your brothers wash shoes.

lines.ku: Hevala wî şa ye. → Hevalên wî şa ne.
lines.en: His friend (f) is happy. → His friends are happy.

activities.instruction: Make it plural: Xalê min difroşe. → ___ me difroşin.

content.explanation: Singular: Xalê min (my uncle). Plural: Xalên me (our uncles). The -ê changes to -ên, and min changes to me.
hatin (to come): ew tê (he/she comes). My cousin comes from the university. Note: hatin has irregular conjugation: ez têm, tu tê, ew tê, em/hûn/ew tên.
